cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn north-northeast tonight, scrape the South and North Carolina coasts, then accelerate northeastward offshore of the Mid-Atlantic toward Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of Charleston, South Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from north of Chincoteague VA to Fenwick Island DE, Chesapeake Bay from Smith Point to Drum Point, and the tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from the NC/VA border to Chincoteague VA and Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point; Hurricane Warning north of Savannah River to the NC/VA border including Pamlico & Albemarle Sounds; Storm-Surge Warning Flagler/Volusia FL line to Poquoson VA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coastline from northeastern Florida through North Carolina and into Virginia, with hazardous surf extending northward to New Jersey and New England
weather_observation.wind: Low (7%) chance of sustained 34-kt winds; most likely outcome is occasional gusts 20–30 mph Friday night into early Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected on the Delaware River; surge threat confined farther south in NC–VA.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain showers possible, totals generally under 2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey coast may hinder pilot boarding and small-vessel movements.
